channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Tariff Agenda Bets on Americans Giving Up Cheap Goods
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent argues that the American dream is about more than cheap televisions, but inflation-weary consumers might disagree.

item.title: CHROs have the ‘second-hardest job in the C-suite’ and a higher turnover rate than any other executive-level position, expert says
item.description: A Spencer Stuart analysis suggests the CHRO role is getting harder, with HR leaders staying in their jobs for a shorter period of time compared to fiv...

item.title: These fast-food chains are most likely to screw up your order
item.description: A 25-year study shows the fastest and most (and least) accurate brands.

item.title: Strategy ends quarter with biggest Bitcoin purchase of year
item.description: The software company-turned-Bitcoin-hoarder holds $43.4 billion in the cryptocurrency.

item.title: Marine Le Pen Barred From French Presidential Run After Embezzlement Ruling
item.description: The sentence made the far-right leader ineligible for five years, excluding her from the 2027 election unless she can secure a more favorable outcome ...

item.title: Circle hires banks for long-awaited IPO, stablecoin giant expected to publicly file late April
item.description: The stablecoin giant, which has sought to go public for years, could list its shares by early summer.

item.title: A NATO Plane Tracks and Dodges Russia in the Baltic Sea
item.description: The assignment was part of a new program aimed at suspected Russian sabotage. None has occurred since NATO began patrols.

item.title: How Much Does America Spend?
item.description: We explore what federal government spends its money on.

item.title: Uber and DoorDash are pressing Republican lawmakers to get President Trump’s ‘no tax on tips’ to apply to their drivers
item.description: Drivers are most frequently classified as independent contractors and receive a 1099, which means they wouldn’t be eligible for that tax break under t...

item.title: Trump Really Likes It When Things Go Wrong
item.description: The problem is that competence and execution matter.

item.title: Soldiers Slow Rescue Efforts in a City Destroyed by Myanmar Earthquake

item.description: Federal authorities in several countries have recently nabbed several caches of weapons headed to Haiti, but armed violence continues to rise there, w...

item.title: As Rescuers Work at Collapsed Bangkok Building, Those Who Found Love There Await News
item.description: The Bangkok building razed by Friday’s quake employed men and women who had found love at work. Despite glimmers of hope, many were still beneath the ...
